content.description: great features down low leads to sustained crimping
content.location: hueco face by an old tree, high first bolt

climbs.name: Swarming Flys
climbs.fa: G. Larsen, JJ Cieslewicz, Nathan Wilson

content.description: New route just right of Screaming Bats.  Fun holds on overhanging wall lead to a challenging crux.  Less difficult climbing above the 5th bolt. Currently the route joins onto Screaming Bats for the last two bolts.
content.protection: 9 Bolts to chains. Shares anchor with Screaming Bats

content.description: Climbs four bolts through overhang on great rock with jugs and underclings. Crux then comes on the crimpy vertical wall above.
content.location:
Located on the Upper Tier.

Walk along the ledge north of the slab. Once you round the corner to the ledge that is above the road  Screamin Bats will be the first route.

content.description:
A slightly harder twin to Bone Ronguer that lies on the same flawless section of limestone. The climbing is mostly 5.10 with the exception of some harder cruxes at the start and near bolt 4.

This is a stellar route.
content.location: Just left of Bone Ronguer on the 3rd (upper) tier. NOTE: this is no place for dogs and children. The 3rd tier lies on a narrow ledge with a big drop off.

content.description: Short Pumpy route. Starts on Jugs and side-pulls. Once you move into an undercling mid-route the business begins. Fun moves the whole way up.
content.location:
Upper Tier Route.

Once you walk around the corner of the upper tier it is the second route. Located 10 feet left of Screamin Bats.

content.description: Shares the first 3 bolts of Boney Fingers then veers right past 5 more bolts to chain anchors.  Thin, crimpy and thoughtful climbing.

Many tenuous moves lead to the rest at a hole, then tackle the extremely thin crux through an overlap near the top. I think it will go with some strong fingers and creative sequencing. Oh, and please try hard to not disturb the rock spirea plants around mid-climb, the sequence avoids them completely.
content.location: Lonely route, first one you pass on the upper tier well before the others up there

content.description: This is the mirror image of (and shares the first bolt with) Catacomb and slants left instead of right. Crux is between 4th and 5th bolts (although the start is tricky as well). Very nice climb on good rock.
content.location: On the 3rd (upper) tier. NOTE: this is no place for dogs or children. The upper tier lies on a narrow ledge with a large drop off.

content.description:
Technical slab route that involves a bit of thinking and trust in your foot work. Route is deceptively thin from how it looks on the ground.  The climbing is varied and a lot of fun. If you think you are a slab master get on this route.

Don't underestimate the climbing under the first bolt! An unclipped fall could be potentially disastrous.
content.protection:
7 bolts to chains.

(bolts up top are a bit close, it is easy to Z-clip if your not on your game.)
content.location: The route is in the upper tier. You must walk past all the routes facing the road and round the north corner of the cliff. after rounding the corner it is the only line of bolts.

content.description:
Right arcing route. Starts with tricky slab climbing   leading to  several large ledges. Moves are Reachy is several spots but are usually on good holds.

Fun route but kind of a pain to clean.
content.location:
Located on the upper tier.

4th route over once you round the corner.

Obvious right arching line that shares anchors with Boney fingers.

content.description: Climbs up thin edges to the "bat cave" watch out for  guano.  Crux is exiting the bat cave using reachy side pulls. Once you leave the bat cave you climb up excellent limestone features with a few tricky moves  thrown in before you hit the top.
content.location:
Located on the Upper Tier.

Route is the third route after you walk around the corner on the upper ledge.

(Yellow route on the Upper Tier beta picture.)

content.description:
This beautiful line on flawless limestone is left of and shares anchors with Dancing Skeleton. Holds are sharp, crimpy edges with a hard start and another crux getting past the 4th bolt. However, almost every move is 5.10.

This really is a superb climb. Kudos to the first ascensionist!
content.location: On the 3rd (upper) tier. NOTE: this is no place for dogs or children! The 3rd tier is on a narrow ledge with a large drop off. Has a distinct alpine feel to it.
